Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

I Stop Somewhere by T. E. Carter

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Aug 16, 2018

I Stop Somewhere is a dark but enthralling and essential read.

Leah on the Offbeat by Becky Albertalli

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Aug 14, 2018

Leah on the Offbeat covers high school, college, sexuality and relationships and is a must-read for anyone with an interest in LGBT issues.

The Belles by Dhonielle Clayton

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Aug 9, 2018

The Belles is a phenomenal, dark and twisted destruction of the beauty myth.

Simon vs. the Homo Sapiens Agenda by Becky Albertalli

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Aug 7, 2018

Emma loved Simon vs. the Homo Sapiens Agenda and recommends it to anyone with an interest in LGBT issues.

Orphan Monster Spy by Matt Kileen

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Aug 2, 2018

Orphan Monster Spy is a gripping, fast-paced novel with a brilliant main character.

A Sky Painted Gold by Laura Wood

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 31, 2018

A Sky Painted Gold is a stunning, addictive read that evokes the glamour and magic of the 1920s.

The Truth About Alice by Jennifer Mathieu

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jul 26, 2018

The Truth About Alice is a short and punchy burst of brilliant feminist YA that every teenager should read.

Bookshop Girl by Chloe Coles

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 24, 2018

Bookshop Girl is a short, sweet story with a smart and determined main character.

The Exact Opposite of Okay by Laura Steven

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jul 19, 2018

The Exact Opposite of Okay introduces teenage readers to important topics with humour and bold characters.

My Box-Shaped Heart by Rachael Lucas

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 17, 2018

My Box-Shaped Heart is an easy, inspiring, uplifting, adorable summer read about the importance of family, friendship and finding your own happily ever after.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
